sentences.en: He preferred the company of those who were intellectually inferior to himself.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢与那些智力水平不如他的人共处。

sentences.en: I admit that I am inferior to him in many respects.
sentences.cn: 我自认在许多方面比他矮半截.

sentences.en: I felt very inferior among all those academics.
sentences.cn: 与那些大学教师在一起，我自惭形秽。

sentences.en: I grudge paying so much for such inferior goods.
sentences.cn: 我不愿花这么多钱买次品.

sentences.en: I'm your inferior in manual dexterity.
If children were made to feel inferior to other children their confidence declined.
sentences.cn: 如果让孩子感觉他们不如其他孩子，他们的信心就会减弱。

sentences.en: It was a gentleman's duty always to be civil, even to his inferiors.
sentences.cn: 一个绅士的责任是一直保持彬彬有礼，即使是对比自己地位低的人。

sentences.en: Joseph made sure that he was never palmed off with inferior stuff.
sentences.cn: 约瑟夫确保自己从不会被骗买一些次等原料。

sentences.en: Most career women make me feel inferior.
sentences.cn: 大部分职业女性让我感到自己不如她们。

sentences.en: The food at that restaurant is inferior.
sentences.cn: 那家饭馆的饭菜质量差.

sentences.en: The house is inferior to what I expected.
sentences.cn: 那房子比我所期望的差.

sentences.en: The rank of captain is inferior.
These oranges are inferior to those I bought last week.
sentences.cn: 这些桔子没我上星期买的好.

sentences.en: They sell inferior goods at that store.
This cloth is not inferior to real silk.
We thought we'd been fobbed off with inferior goods.
sentences.cn: 我们以为对方向我们骗售劣质货物.

trans.tran_cn: （质量等）低劣的，下级的，下等的，（位置在）下面的，[植]下位的
trans.tran_en: not good, or not as good as someone or something else

trans.tran_cn: 部下，下属，次品，晚辈，[印]下角码
trans.tran_en: someone who has a lower position or rank than you in an organization
